title: Norman Brooks (singer)
text:
Norman Brooks (August 19, 1928 – September 14, 2006) was a Canadian <a href="singer">singer</a>, best known for his ability to sound like <a href="Al%20Jolson">Al Jolson</a>.
He was born Norman Joseph Arie, the son of Lebanese parents, in <a href="Montreal">Montreal</a>, <a href="Quebec">Quebec</a>, Canada in 1928. He played Jolson in the 1956 film, "<a href="The%20Best%20Things%20in%20Life%20Are%20Free%20%28film%29">The Best Things in Life Are Free</a>". Brooks performed in <a href="nightclub">nightclub</a>s and on television in the United States and Canada during the 1950s and 1960s. He played himself in the 1960 film "<a href="Ocean%27s%20Eleven%20%281960%20film%29">Ocean's Eleven</a>".
His records "Hello Sunshine" and "You Shouldn't Have Kissed Me The First Time" for the Zodiac Records label were national hits in 1953. His song "A Sky-Blue Shirt and a Rainbow Tie" reached No. 17 in the <a href="UK%20Singles%20Chart">UK Singles Chart</a> in November 1954.
